Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Dan G
Reviews.Content: Very courteous staff. Breakfast buffet was excellent. Room was clean. The only downside - many of the HD channels on the tv did not work, including HBO.

Reviews.Title: “Very Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Lara P
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights, and I was very pleased with the hotel. The staff was very attentive, even greeting us each time we re-entered the hotel. Although it was right next to the highway, our room faced away from it and we had no problem with noise. The location is very convenient -- a short drive from the MetroCenter, with many shops and restaurants. Quick access to the highway made it easy to get to attractions and the airport. The pool was heated and clean. We loved our room, which was spacious and clean as well. There was a large selection of good breakfast items, including a couple of hot entrees, oatmeal, and fresh fruit. It is located in an office park, so it doesn't have a "resort" feel to it, but the hotel itself was terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Loud and Hot”
Reviews.Author: Fencelover
Reviews.Content: Our room was #321 right across from the elevator. We asked to move rooms due to the constant "dinging" of the elevator but were told the hotel was full (we were there for Easter) and there were no other rooms. We tried to make the best out of it but the elevator did "ding" ALL night. Not only when it got to the third floor but every time it passed the third floor. Besides that - the air conditioning has some sort of control on it where it shuts off if you try to turn it too low. Our 5 nights there were LONG, loud and HOT! Also, they went through and took out all of the vending machines from the hotel - beverages and snacks. They want you to purchase food from their little cafe in the front but it was too expensive. Just under $5 for 2 bottles of water! There was free breakfast in the morning but the food was stale and unappealing. We would not say there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent N. Phoenix One Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: ProfPass
Reviews.Content: While this is a freeway hotel nd certainly not a resort, our room was large with a sepairate living room, refrigerator, king bed, bar, and an electronic system to support any array of electronic devices and a large flat sceen tv. The pool/jacuzzi was pleasant and the breakfast with a few hot selections was very good. The wifi was free and fast - for one nighters this is a good choice. Select a room away from the freeway.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not a great location”
Reviews.Author: jchan3
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff were nice, but the location was not in the best area. My room was nice, very spacious, but my colleague said his room was very noisy as he was on the freeway side. The staff was nice I just wish there was more in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: mloucks1112
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, along with a bunch of our friends stayed here Feb. 10-14 as we were in town for a wedding. The location was great, right off I-17. At checkin and throughout our stay, the staff was great. They were extremely friendly and courteous. The room was great, comfortable bed, nice large TV. The bathroom was really small. The sink was outside the bathroom so just the toilet and shower/tub were in there but it was pretty small but no big deal. Our room was right across from the elevator and the hotel was filled with kids who were there for some sort of sports tournament. In the mornings, it could be a little noisey but what do you expect from kids? I didn't bother us as we had things going on so its not like we needed to sleep until 10AM or anything. It was great having a free breakfast every morning. Good way to save a few bucks. Overall, I would definitely stay here again if I ever visit Phoenix in the future. Clean, comfortable, and easy to get to.

Reviews.Title: “They care”
Reviews.Author: GRAVEBEAR
Reviews.Content: Sometimes its just the staff. Room was nice.... Staff was very attentive

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: rlephdpe
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at a Hyatt Place and it was a very nice experience. All staff that we encountered were very friendly and helpful - each of them definitely cared about the customer. Room was clean and fairly spacious, but things were a little cramped where the bathroom door opens into the tub and toilet area. Breakfast was fine and the late night food service available at the front desk was a definite plus. We enjoyed having this facilty as home base as we attended the Fiesta Bowl and also looked around Scottsdale, Mesa, Tempe, Glendale, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed :(”
Reviews.Author: Summer L
Reviews.Content: The pull out sofa was filthy under the cushions. The amenities were very sub-par compared to other comparitive hotels I have stayed at. As a few examples I had to ask for lotion and the lotion that was provided was very poor quality. I might as well have rubbed water into my skin. Other items that are nice to have without asking are q-tips and cotton balls. The continental breakfast was very skimpy. Any items other than basic cereal toast and unripened fruit were not complimentary. I ordered breakfast from the kiosk and paid for it with my credit card only to be told that my selection was not available. The waffles I was offered as a substitue were disgusting and tasted like baking soda. The food service worker's attitude was non-apologetic. The bed in our room was uncomfortable. The A/C unit was very loud each time it would come on, making it difficult to get a good night's rest. Overall, I was disappointed with our stay here. I have stayed at much nicer places for the same price or less. The pool was average, but there was no hot tub, which I thought was odd. Just one more amenity that you would think would be there, but are disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing”
Reviews.Author: T K
Reviews.Content: Returning to Santa Barbara, our flight was cancelled in Phoenix due to weather. As normal the frustration you feel when you just want to be home, led us to book a room overnight at a nearby hotel. My colleague and I arrived merely seconds before a shuttle of additional flight cancellation passengers, lucky for us. The customer service received by 'Rafael' was so refreshing! Rafael as well as the waiter who attended to us made us feel so welcome! The facility itself was very nice, clean, and maintained well. Good Customer Service is so hard to come by these days and I wanted to extend my appreciation to 'Rafael' and his colleagues for doing a great job! "Ultimately, contentment is more a shift in attitude than a change in circumstances" TKays, California

Reviews.Title: “Hotel management was awesome when Expedia Customer Service sucked!”
Reviews.Author: KO J
Reviews.Content: I stayed the weekend. Had a problem arise that would have been much less difficult if Expedia Customer Service wasn't so inflexible, difficult, and flat-out dishonest. (I will not use Expedia EVER again!) I went down from my room and spoke with the Hyatt Place weekend manager, Jen, at the front desk. She listened patiently to my situation, explained the current room availability, and asked that I have Expedia call her directly. So, I did. (No help there.) But she did not give up on me. Through her diligence and professionalism, my situation was quickly resolved and my family was happy. Our accommodations were beautiful and the entire staff was great! I highly recommend this hotel to any travelers to the North Phoenix area. I would also recommend that they request a room on the side that IS NOT facing the freeway. (Not much sound protection there. If there had been, I would have rated my stay there as Excellent!) Thank you to Manager Jen for being awesome! Kelly J PS: Beware the addictive chocolate chunk cookies in the cafe! (Especially warmed up!) So good they should be illegal!

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate - Friendly and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: KevinMJM
Reviews.Content: Earlier this summer, I wanted to book an overnight local getaway because there was work being done on my house in Phoenix. I found a great price at this location and booked it. Having checked prior Tripadvisor reviews, I was aware of the possibility of highway noise. So, I asked for a room facing away from the highway and that made all the difference! The room was immaculate and very comfortable! At this location, the rooms really do look like the photos on the Website. (That isn't always the case.) The bed was so comfortable that I didn't want to leave. Actually, I was quite content to hang out in the room to finish up a work assignment. Breakfast was, as another reviewer had commented, healthy - with a varied selection. I gather, from the location - near a suburban North Phoenix office park, that this hotel caters mostly to a business clientele. I was there on a weekend and it was moderately busy. All the staff were most friendly and helpful - providing the feeling of a smaller boutique hotel. This is a terrific place to stay. (Just remember to book a room facing away from the highway.) You won't regret your decision!

Reviews.Title: “Super nice hotel with great caring staff”
Reviews.Author: ValdezFamilyest2004
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight in a King room with a family of 4, on the east side of the building (away from the freeway side). We have a teen & toddler who slept on the pull-out couch with no complaints. The room was super, so much space for all of us to move around. Loved that the toilet & shower were separate from the sink/vanity area. We had a kitchen table, sink, & refrigerator, too. The TV was HUGE, which of course my children loved. The pool was awesome, it was the perfect temperature for a late night swim. The staff was great, Cade was very welcoming & informative upon our arrival. Alecia was super helpful, I'm pregnant & got hit with bad heartburn at 2am and she helped me find a speedy remedy! She was also very friendly in the middle of the night & I appreciated her company. The free morning breakfast was well rounded, biscuits & gravy, donuts, bagels, yogurt, fruit, juices, etc. My husband also enjoyed the Starbucks coffee. We advance purchased our room online and saved a great deal by doing it that way. I believe our total was under $70...well worth the money! Highly recommend this clean & quiet hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Like Home”
Reviews.Author: DaveLongBeach_CA
Reviews.Content: Quite possibly the friendliest hotel we have ever stayed in. From the front desk to the maids, every employee had a smile and was anxious to help if you had a question. The Continental Breakfast was outstanding and was geared toward health and not fat with an over load of sweets. We will be back, and soon we hope.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: treecorn
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in May for my graduation from Grand Canyon University. It was situated close to everything we needed and the front staff were very helpful with everything. The only problems I could find with this stay was that the carpet siding by the a/c had fallen off the wall, I forgot to tell the front desk about this. Also the layout of the rooms with the vanity in front of the beds makes it hard for anyone to sleep in. Overall we enjoyed our stay here, the breakfast was good, rooms were clean, and staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Highway to hell”
Reviews.Author: Smithsd1
Reviews.Content: You will not sleep because of traffic. If you call down they will say no more rooms and tell you to put the noisy zircon on and that some people are light sleepers. We live on 6th avenue in NYC and sleep quite well there.

Reviews.Title: “SO COMFORTABLE”
Reviews.Author: itropicbird
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my son who had soccer games in town. We made a reservation for a "guest room" and were pleased to find it was a suite. The sitting area alone was 12' x 15', outfitted with a big L-shaped couch that folded out to a Queen bed, a big ottoman, business desk, wet bar and dresser. It was separated from the sleeping area by an attractive partial wall/room divider. The decor was modern but warm, not stark, and the room was immaculate. Everything--hallways, elevators, carpets--were spotless. The beds and pillow were comfy, and the air conditioner magically kept the room at the perfect temp noiselessly. There were marble countertops, a full length mirror. In-room Wi-Fi was painless to log onto, didn't need a passcode. A swiveling 42" flat screen TV allowed us to watch from just about anywhere in the room. There was plenty of parking and a security guard was walking around the grounds at night. Late check-in was no problem as the desk is staffed 24 hours. The check-in desk is continuous with the cocktail bar, which I thought was a little unusual. All the staff were courteous and friendly regardless of the time of day. Continental breakfast was standard fare of oatmeal, cereal, muffins, toast, bagels, and fruit, stepped up a notch with nice plates and Starbucks coffee. An added nice service was a computer screen in the breakfast area where you could swipe your key card and order a hot entree (like a breakfast burrito) and have it charged to your room. The downsides: Our room faced the freeway so there was ongoing traffic noise, not enough to keep us awake but if you are a light sleeper you may want to request a room on the other side. The bathroom light/fan was loud and the shower squealed, also the sink was outside of the shower area so it was hard to use it and not wake your hotel-mate. Our key cards didn't work well at the back door so we had to swipe and swipe several times before it would let us in. Not enough to prevent us from coming back though. It's a short drive to restaurants, fast food, and stores, and easy to find just off the freeway. After one night we were offered a special price at another hotel where the rest of the team was staying--we said "NO"--we were just so comfortable where we were! SO COMFORTABLE and an outstanding value.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: PaulVonEvil
Reviews.Content: Before I gush about how amazingly amazing this hotel was, let me state that I came about this place after a bad experience at another hotel just hours before. I was so glad I found this gem! However after being greeted and assisted so courteously during such a busy time of year (Spring Training) AND with a last minute need for a room, my gladness turned into pure jubilation! The rate was extremely reasonable, especially after I got to my room. I did no prior research into this property, in fact it was my partner's decision to check it out. The lobby is cute and modern, and the staff members were more than happy to give me a tour of the floor's amenities. The interior of the hallways were nice and the room was even nicer. It was very modern, with a comfy sofa and ottoman, a sink area for dishes as well as a mini fridge. The bed area separated by a nicely adorned wall and the washing area lit and maintained well (the marble was a nice touch!) The bathroom was a little small, but then again you're not in there for very long. The bed was extremely comfy! The sheets were nice and so was the down comforter. The real show stopper was the gorgeous 42" HDTV. It was the center of the room and pivoted to accommodate bed or sofa viewing. For the price this place was amazing. I've stayed at resorts that cost more and weren't nearly as nice. Add on the fact that you are able to order movies in room that are still in theater and this makes for a great hotel for when you're travelling with a loved one and just want to get away for a nice evening out. The continental breakfast offered the next morning was great as well! Not only did they have Starbucks and Tazo teas on tap, but they carried high quality jams, marmalade, juices and milks as well. Fantastic! And if the free breakfast wasn't enough, you could order food from the kitchen, talk about convenience. The checkout process was even easier, with options to check out from the room, a kiosk out in the lobby or in person at the front desk. The property exterior was clean upon leaving in the morning and it was nice and quiet all night. This may just become our new hotel of choice when we're on this side of town!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Clean, Sufficient and Accommodating!”
Reviews.Author: SweetpCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We flew into Phoenix Arizona early Saturday morning. We arrived at the Hyatt Place at approximately 10AM. We were well aware that check in was not until at least 3PM but being that we requested an early check in online, we figured we would give it a try. We were greeted by Mario at the front desk. We gave him our reservation information. He made sure there was a room available for us and checked us right in. The hotel itself is very modern and clean. This hotel is a Hyatt Place, so if you are used to the Grand Hyatt or Hyatt Regency ,this is a much smaller facility. Our room was spacious. It had a living area with a sofa bed, a wet bar and refrigerator. It was stocked with the customary Hyatt toiletries, shampoo, conditioner, toothpaste, etc. We tried to take a nap but since our room was on the side facing the freeway there was a bit of noise from the traffic. After approx 2-3 hours of the traffic noise, we called the front desk to see if they could move us to a different room. Much to our surprise Mario went out of his way to make sure he found us a room away from the freeway noise. We can not emphasize how much we appreciated the outstanding customer service provided to us from this young man. Once we settle in we went out to grab something to eat. Having Poppadeux seafood restaurant next door was a bonus! They have amazing seafood dishes! Our trip was mainly for the St. Louis Rams vs. Arizona Cardinals game. The drive was approximately about 15 minutes to the stadium. We had no problem getting there with the use of our GPS. If you are looking for a clean, comfortable and safe place to stay, we highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice !”
Reviews.Author: hotelzrockzz
Reviews.Content: I absolutley love the hotel !! This is accualy the first verry modern hotel Ive every stayed at. I love the food , the 42 inch hd plasma tv , and the comfy beds ! Brandy at the desk was extremely helpfull. She deserves a huge pat on the back. Ill be back !

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in local area, probably best for business travelers...”
Reviews.Author: LisaLongIsland
Reviews.Content: because of its location fine dining is very sparse & there's not much to do in the immediate area. If you're stopping over for a day or two it's very nice. The staff was very attentive. Hotel was new & very clean. Ask for a quiet room opposite the highway. If you're looking for a vacation spot go over to Scottsdale. Phoenix proper was as dead as a "tombstone" & locals told me people don't really walk around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I want in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: sstone67
Reviews.Content: This was a quick trip, 2 nights, so I didn't use much of the facility but the staff was very friendly and courteous. Room was clean and comfortable, slept like a baby. Bathroom is small but was all that I needed. Pool area was kept clean and stocked with fresh towels. Location was close to all the places I had lined up to go to. Liked the comfort of the room the best, maybe I wasn't there long enough but I didn't dislike anything about it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, poor customer service.”
Reviews.Author: oldschoolgnu
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay the hotel was beautiful and the pool was fabulous in the 110 degree heat. The staff was not so wonderful. The were very unfriendly when you could find one. The most we needed was our room key re-keyed, not a very challenging or teadious task and they acted like we were inconviencing them. One of the members in our party needed to be taken to the hotel and their complementary shuttle turned into a $45 fee. The breakfast was good and they kept the area nice and clean! Overall I would go back!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, could use some work”
Reviews.Author: marieTX
Reviews.Content: Pros: Nice decor, huge plasma TV that swivels so you can watch in bed or on the big sofa, very lovely granite countertops. Front desk clerk Brandy is very, very nice, helpful. Great complimentary breakfast. Quiet if you get a room away from the highway. Computers, printers are free. Cons: Plumbing is old and noisy. Bathrooms are very small , bathroom door is old, scratched, and the carpet is old (old burn marks and worn). Looks like Hyatt just took the cheap route--did a half-baked, superficial job on the upgrade. Only criticism is when I asked for a printed receipt when checking out, a staffer (older woman with a pony-tail) looked surprised, acted as if I was imposing on her with this standard request. Maybe Hyatt docks the staff for paper used to print receipts.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Patterson3663
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel for a great price and it completely exceeded our standards! The room was great, and the staff was AWESOME and super helpful! I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone on a bit of a budget that still wants to have a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Well appointed rooms”
Reviews.Author: socnty
Reviews.Content: Was greeted at the door by a very friendly staffer [ I believe her name was Jessica] who checked us in. The rooms are very spacious and clean, beds were very plush and comfortable, there was 50 in flat screen in the room. My only complaint would be the slow drain in the tub, I was standing 2 in of water while showering. Oh yeah and some guy took my english muffin that I was toasting at the free continental breakfast. Just a commentary on inconsiderate people...

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: maxtonio
Reviews.Content: Hotel is super easy to get to from I-17. It's located behind business offices and a Crowne Plaza hotel. Wanted a room not facing the freeway, but only room available was near the elevator. What a mistake... the hallways are not carpeted and could hear clomping footsteps and dinging elevators late into the night. Room set up was nice with the sofa bed and ottoman, a small work table and a great 42-inch swivel tv. Would have liked a microwave. Wi-Fi worked great, plus they had on-demand printing so you could complete online check in for your boarding pass and then go to the business center to print it out. Coffee pot was one of those small one-cup deals. Continental breakfast - as others have posted - was a little skimpy. No travel brochures in the lobby because this was a "business" hotel rather than a tourist hotel. Express kiosk check out was a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Annie61683
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for three nights. Overall, my husband and I were both happy with our decision. The highlight was definitely having a full couch in the room, as opposed to having to lay in bed to watch tv. Big tv in the room was nice as well. The bed was comfy and extra pilows were available at the front desk. If you're a light sleeper, make sure you request a room opposite the highway. The noise bugged my husband, but I slept just fine. Breakfast was kind of disappointing. Bread, bagels, oatmeal, yogurt, and fruit. You could order a hot breakfast (as well as lunch and dinner) for a moderate price. Another definite perk was the wine for purchase in the lobby (until 11pm). That helped cap off our romantic night out. Staff was helpful and polite. Lobby was comfy. Overall, a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Nice, Nice”
Reviews.Author: Bobkatevan
Reviews.Content: Only have good things to say about this hotel. Located near Metro Mall, about 1 mile away, which is where we needed to be. Clean rooms, nice plasma television, nice linens and beds, nice bathroom. Breakfast included downstairs. I have no complaints and would definitly stay here again, without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay at double the price”
Reviews.Author: 80sMan
Reviews.Content: We had never stayed at the Hyatt Place prior to our trip. We relied upon Trip Advisor reviews to book our room. I'm happy to say that the reviews we spot on! The rooms were nicely appointed, very clean and very well laid out. The front lobby service was excellent and the staff friendly and courteous. The room was bigger and better appointed than a many other places I've stayed that were two and three times the money. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “comfy place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Germ-a-phobes
Reviews.Content: After a trip of staying in budget hotels this place was great. The staff were all very helpful and friendly. Everything in our room and throughout the rest of the hotel was clean, nicely arranged, and just had a general comfortable feeling about it. The pool was great but could use a good cleaning. Breakfast was good with some fresh fruit, and yogurt, in addition to the usual cereal, coffee, and bread. There is one ice machine located on the third floor which seems odd to me for a four floor hotel as nice as this one. The TV is nice but navigating channels was aggravating enough that I left it off most off most of the time. It has hookups so that you could play movies on it through your laptop etc. via component, composite, HDMI, etc. This could be very handy if you've got some down time with kids. The location is great, right on I-17 and not far from I-10. Getting around was very easy, there is almost every restaurant you could want within 10 miles one way or another. Metro center was a 5 minute trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: AliBear19
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on our way to the Grand Canyon. The room was very nice, although it had double beds. The pool was nice, especially with the +40C weather. Great continental breakfast. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “very peaceful, one night stay”
Reviews.Author: RamblinRabbits
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night at the Hyatt Place North in Phoenix, AZ after flying into Sky Harbor. US Airways lost my husbands luggage on the way in, so we were thankful that the hotel had lots of free toiletries for him. The lady at the front desk was very nice. Our stay was short but very peaceful and relaxing. The hotel was quiet and clean. Breakfast was good. I would definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Hyatt Place with all the good and the not so good”
Reviews.Author: fenwayman
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at this Hyatt Place on business. The hotel is typical of the Hyatt Place brand. It feels like a recent renovation and is nicely decorated, with a large open area lobby and plenty of parking. The room I was given was large with the usual weird arrangement of furniture that makes it impossible to watch television if you are using the kitchenette area or the work desk. The living area and bedroom were bright and nicely decorated, clean, and comfortable. Like most Hyatt Place's, the bathroom was a step below the rest of the room: small, practical, with a really loud fan (you turn on the light and you get a lot of fan noise, too). Water pressure was awful, and the water never really got hot. I do love Hyatt's soap though. The worst thing about the room was the linen on the bed, which was very course and scratchy. I am rarely bothered by this but the sheets were so uncomfortable that I had trouble sleeping. The second worst thing was the internet, which was barely usable. It connected fine, but had so little bandwidth that I gave up trying to work with it. The breakfast was nice. I went as soon as it opened so everything was fresh and plentiful, except for seating. There were only five people at breakfast but the layout of the tables and chairs in the hotel lobby actually made it awkward; it's designed for groups to dine together, not for business travelers. The exercise room has three pieces of cardio equipment. The business center worked fine for me to print some things. I stayed here because the rate was good, and I feel I got what I paid for. It's totally adequate for business stays, but it's not a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “loved the concept...”
Reviews.Author: btworld
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed two nights here with my sister. I loved the media set up in the room and the 42 inch TV was great. I really loved the vibe and the people who worked there were upbeat and friendly. We enjoyed the breakfast and liked the fact that we could get a late night snack too. I would recommend it to all types of travelers,

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Jintyfrub
Reviews.Content: We recently took a trip to see a Dodgers spring training game at their new facility in Glendale, Arizona. We had not been to the Phoenix area in quite a few years so really did not have a clue to what hotel we were going to stay at. After reviewing a few hotels we decided to stay at the Hyatt Place Phoenix North. The rate seemed good, the photos and reviews of the property made it looked acceptable. When we arrived we had the choice of a self check in kiosk or the one person who was checking people in, we chose the kiosk, simple and easy. We needed to head to the grocery store and a gas station so we asked the young gal at the front desk (I have indicated she was young because she did not know where anything was located.) We were sent by this gal in opposite directions one was in a very bad part of town the other in halfway decent part of town. In the morning when it was time to take a shower there was hardly any water pressure and it took 5 minutes to get warm water (What a waste of water, when there are signs everywhere to please conserve.) We then went down to the “Continental Breakfast” When we arrived it was 9:20 AM the workers were literally forcing the coffee pumps out of our hands! They could not get cleaned up fast enough plus were extremely rude. We then decided to take off and grab a bite somewhere else. We exited our room at 9:45 AM. Put the privacy sign back inside and went on our merry way. When we came back at 5:00 PM we noticed when we got off the elevator there was a table full of dirty dishes that had not been cleaned up from the morning (I assume these were plates from other rooms left there.) We then found that the maid decided not to clean our room. I called the front desk; she was extremely nice and said I will have housekeeping give me a call. Well housekeeping called I told them to just bring us towels. A woman brought the towels and told me the maid left at 3:00PM so no one was there to clean the room! The hotel also did not seem very secure the doors to the outside were not locked and there wasn’t any security that we could see. Overall I would not recommend staying at this hotel to anyone for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “They do not keep their word”
Reviews.Author: Tarian1
Reviews.Content: I knew my husband would be in this area and called in advance to book his room. I read all the reviews and felt this was a pretty good hotel and they told me no problem setting him up in a smoking room. Ok..I know many people do not like smoking...but.. a lot of us still do and if we pay for the right to do so...at the last minute as you are standing there they say ...no smoking...that is wrong. I even called this morning and spoke to them to make sure he would have NO problems checking in. He had problems and they I believe felt he was struck there...within minutes I switched him to a better property and they couldn't have been nicer. This new property even had a pool and were in a much better location than the Hyatt Place it is rather out of the way...and seemed much older. They have some really great resorts in Phoenix and even some that really cater to families...take your time and look around. I must say...Gold Rush Transportation is amazing they picked him up in a Lincoln Towne car within 5 minutes and whisk him to a better location. I believe you must be what you represent and your word of honor must count for something. This was not the case here and I hope you look else where. No airport transportation either...you are on your own to hire that as well. Sorry..I wasted so much time and effort here.

Reviews.Title: “Superb, Fantastic, Wonderful - A Must”
Reviews.Author: somobr
Reviews.Content: What a find... This hotel is a diamond at an unbelievably cheap cheap cheap price.. We paid $79 p/n and they should have charged us more like $179 p/n. Great facilities - beautiful, spacious rooms with lovely bathroom and accessories. Our King Size room had a plasma, lounge area, robes - you really couldn't ask for more... In addition this particular hotel provides 2nd to none service - this is our story. We were driving from San Diego to Phoenix before we headed off to the Grand Canyon, It was 114degrees, when our car breaks down in the middle of the dessert. We manage to fix it, however an hour out from the hotel we get a text message to say my partners father had passed away in Cleveland Ohio. As you can imagine we were shattered and when we got to the hotel needed help. Chris the Assistant General Manager in particular was incredible and got his team to rally round. They looked after us, helped me get our car exchanged (only took 9 phone calls), let us use the internet all night till we booked our flights and accommodation to Ohio so we could make the funeral, let us use the phone at Front Desk so we incurred no fees. We also had to cancel the next 3 nights accommodation etc etc. They were so supportive and helpful, organised taxis, made sure we ate and in all honesty although the 2 previous hotels we'd stayed at in San Diego and LA were great, I don't believe for a minute they were 1 inch as helpful as these guys. Not only, this, they let us leave our car in their car park, stored all our luggage and had a room ready for us should we wish to stay another night when we returned. Without these guys the whole nightmare of finding out about my father in law, a broken down car, would have been 10 x worse. What fantastic service - you can't even dream that a team would be so helpful.. . The hotel rooms were great, the food great, the helpfulness of staff great.... The pool was ok but to be honest too hot for us to sit out there for too long so we went shopping instead the day we got back to Phoenix.... ... If you need a place to stay in Phoenix and this is the location you are looking for - do no pass up this hotel you will not be disappointed... Thank you to Chris and his Team !!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but needs work”
Reviews.Author: Zaphod
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights on business. The rooms are great, with a comfortable bed and plenty of room to spread out. The "kitchen" consists of a sink, a mini refrigerator, and a coffeemaker. There is no microwave. If you are looking for a real kitchen, head for the nearby Candlewood Suites or possibly the Homewood Suites. The hotel staff was great, providing friendly and prompt service. The housekeeping was fine, although they didn't always leave the full complement of drinking glasses, no biggie. The continental breakfast was satisfactory, with an array of fresh fruit, breads and bagels, and cereals. Cooked items cost extra. There is wireless in the room, but if you don't have a wireless card (as a Federal employee, I can't use one), there doesn't appear to be a port in the room. There are two computers with internet access in the business center. A few problems kept me from giving this hotel a higher rating. Foremost, the shower was unsatisfactory. The pressure was low and the temperature was only lukewarm the first morning. I complained to the front desk, who noted it on their maintenance sheet. The next day, the pressure was a bit better, but the temperature was still lacking. After speaking with some of my fellow lodgers, I found that there were all sorts of problems. In addition to those similar to mine, others complained that the water was too hot. One mentioned that he turned on the shower about ten minutes before he got in, so I tried this on my last day. It worked, but what a waste of water! Another issue was that the switches on the lights near the bed did not work very well. One was so stiff that I was afraid that it might short out, so I unplugged it. Finally, I think this hotel has very few outgoing phone lines. I needed to call my airline, and over the course of a half hour, I kept getting a busy signal. I dialed using my cell phone and got through immediately. It may have been a coincidence, but I'm suspicious. In summary, it was an okay experience, but there are probably better options in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, lacking service”
Reviews.Author: Kayte4321
Reviews.Content: I was slightly skeptical about staying here after reviews I had read. They were right. The room itself was as the website said, and nice except that there was a strong scent of mildew when you walked in. Fortunately or not, we got used to it after a few minutes. The air conditioner was also quite loud, loud enough to wake me up sometimes when it kicked back on in the night, and I'm a fairly heavy sleeper. The shower floor was also not particularly clean. The room itself seemed ok though. The tv was nice, the bed was nice and the room was big. The bathroom sink was "modern" and lacking water pressure. The breakfast was a fairly light continental breakfast, but it was ok. Cereal, fruit, bead and oatmeal, but when we got down, there wasn't much left, had to ask the desk for hot water and something other than bagels. Hot items could be purchased for around $3. The staff wasn't particularly attentive but cleared everything out right at 10, when the hours stopped, including the coffee. The service at the hotel was lacking in general, check-in felt more like a motel 6 than a Hyatt. They had the option for conputerized check-in at a kiosk, and with the attention paid by staff, it might as well have been a computer. They took our credit card, handed us room keys and didn't say an extra word. It was the same with check out. It took work to get any info out of them at all. All in all, we got this for $98 when most of the hotels at about the same level were about $150 so it was an ok experience but we found that the usual charge was about $160 so would have been quite unhappy if we had paid their rack rate.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: jeffirv70
Reviews.Content: Big rooms. Almost the size of a suite. Had everything we needed. Fridge broke and a new one was brought up within 10 minutes. Flat screen TV is awesome and the hotel cable programing was some of the best I've ever had. Beds were comfy. Continental breakfast was pretty lame. Showers were hot. Great central location. Hotel staff was very friendly. Cafe/lobby food and drink was expensive. Pool was small. Overall very nice experience though. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT rooms, poor service”
Reviews.Author: saxorob
Reviews.Content: Beautiful, large, pseudo-suite rooms. If you're into nice tvs, you'll love the ones in the rooms here. Beds are fantastic, with a huge sofa sectional on the other side of the room. The tv is well-placed in the room to be seen whether lying in the bed or sitting on the sofa. We also agree with recent posts about dim lighting in the bathroom. The biggest problem here though is with the front desk staff, as most all of them need more training. Both times I called down to ask to be connected to a friend's room, Keisha put me on hold three times, each time coming back to re-ask for the spelling of the name "Weiss". When we stopped by to ask for directions for the nearest fitness center, she set us out on foot in the opposite direction. We are staying as part of a large group, and when we went downstairs to pay the bill to check out, another clerk said she didn't know how to do the check-out for a group - that person would not be in until the next day. And yesterday we came back in from being out all day and our room had not been made up. A manager came up with replacement towels, asked if we could make the beds up ourselves, and offered us free breakfast in the morning. Sure enough the next morning, getting the desk staff to understand that our breakfast to be covered took 15 minutes and another visit from a different manager. Then there was confusion because the hot breakfast items are billed from the kitchen window in the breakfast room, but the cinnamon rolls are billed from the counter in the lobby. It created two different bills, which confused the girl at the desk even more. This is a beautiful hotel, and very comfortable. I would think that with a couple of weeks of "stand-down" training for each employee, they would have a great product to sell here.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Kiosk check-in and plasma TV!”
Reviews.Author: LocationIntelligent
Reviews.Content: This is evidently a renovated AmeriSuites. They did an excellent job. The decor was great. Huge plasma TV, wireless internet worked well with VPN, in-room fridge. They have check-in Kiosks which are great! It works just like checking-in for a flight at an airport Kiosk. We arrived at 11pm after a long flight and it was nice to just swipe my card, enter a Frequent Flyer Number and be assigned a room. No waiting in line for the Host. Spits the key out and a receipt with your room number. You can still check in/out the old fashioned way as well. The Host at night serves as check-in, bartender and rings you up for previously prepared food. I had a Muffin and sandwich which were pretty good, but not made fresh. It really is setup as a one stop shop for business traveler, loved the lobby area. The shower was poorly lit. It has a hand held shower head. I prefer a traditional one, this was pressing a bit to be trendy and modern. The was not enough pressure to use it while hanging on the wall without bumping into the mounting hardware. There is a lot of ROAD NOISE. The highway is right outside certain rooms and you will need to turn on the noisy fan unit to drown it out.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: manitoba64
Reviews.Content: Stayed here December 20-29/07. It's in a huge business park along with a few other hotel chains. Nice decor, good sized suites and great beds. Great continental breakfast. You can also pay for some breakfast items (I didn't) but I heard others say they were very good. They have a friendly staff and you can't beat the big screen TV in the room that can swivel to wherever you're sitting. I do wish, however, that they got a few more channels. I booked through Expedia and it cost me only $65/night. The fitness center was fine although I would have liked to have some weights in there. Turn left out of the hotel and within a five minute walk is a TGI Friday's and a great seafood restaurant. Once you go past that it is nothing but residential. Turn right and keep walking until you hit West Peoria Ave., turn right again and keep walking for about ten more minutes (about 15 in total from the hotel) and you have a ton of restaurants on West Peoria and the side streets to your left. Turn left on West Peoria from the hotel and there isn't anything but more business park and eventually a non-descript neighborhood. One caveat: I was told by Hyatt head office there is a free airport shuttle. There isn't. The hotel has one that goes anywhere within 5 miles of the property. It is a $40 cab ride to/from the airport which is something I didn't expect. Would I stay here again and recommend it? The cab expense was disappointing but otherwise, I would definitely stay here again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Lipstick on the pig”
Reviews.Author: ghostmoves
Reviews.Content: Strange mix of high-end and cheesy. First the good: nice beds, good room redesign and technology in rooms with refrigerator, free wifi and nice TV. Now the bad: cold shower BOTH times in my 2 stays there, website promised 24/7 food (as of Oct. and its Nov. now) and fitness center with weights ... both were missing. Clueless front desk staff like the worst Motel 6, could not answer simple questions or get my loyalty number into the system. No blue "Equal" packs for coffee, just pink as in low-end places. Beware, the property fronts on a freeway so your room may be noisy. If other Hyatt Place properties are like this one, the brand will flop.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good choice”
Reviews.Author: NYCroadtrip
Reviews.Content: No hot water! No 24-hr dining center (as promised). Bathroom was not clean, toilet seat broken; garbage left in room. Cigarette odors. Flat screen TV has very few channels. No microwaves in rooms. Nasty breakfast. And, you sleep right next to a very noisy freeway. We also found the front desk unhelpful in resolving these issues. At $159/night, what a gip!

HotelInfo.Name: Hyatt Place Phoenix - North
HotelInfo.Address: 10838 North 25th Avenue, Phoenix, AZ 85029 (Formerly "AmeriSuties")
